summary: NPD: The Nintendo Switch Was The Best-Selling Hardware For April 2019
title: NPD: The Nintendo Switch Was The Best-Selling Hardware For April 2019
body:
NPD: The Nintendo Switch Was The Best-Selling Hardware For April 2019

Another month of NPD data brings another month of good news for Nintendo. According to NPD analyst Mat Piscatella, the Nintendo Switchwas the best-selling hardware for the month of April 2019. Piscatella says that “Nintendo Switch sales growth was offset by declines across all other hardware platforms”, which resulted in April hardware spending being 29% lower than a year ago. But that’s not…

View On WordPress

blog.description:
(This is a roleplay blog run by @chickadee567)

((Talking out of character))

Hello there! I’m Professor Sakura, and I’m always willing

to help trainers and caretakers with their Pokemon.

You can ask me about Pokemon behavior, where certain Pokemon can be found,

and even report sightings of rare or mythical Pokemon.

((Search for the tag #rules to find rules for asks and submissions!))

summary: Do you have any tips for Altaria care? And would they be good support pokemon for mental illnesses?
question: Do you have any tips for Altaria care? And would they be good support pokemon for mental illnesses?
answer:
Altaria are excellent support Pokemon! Their soft feathers and humming are very good at calming people down.

  • Altaria are omnivores with a preference towards berries and nuts.
  • You should give your Altaria a bath at least twice a week.
  • They ove being brushed! Just be sure not to brush too hard.
  • A raspy singing voice is a sign that they’re sick or overusing their voice. You should train them to not put too much strain on their vocal chords. If they’re sick, take them to the doctor.
  • Altaria get along well with most Pokemon. They even get along well with other Dragon-types!
  • The Swablu line is considered the second easiest Dragon-type to take care of.

- Professor Sakura

- Professor Sakura

summary: Hey professor, hope you've had a good day! Any tips for a beginner pidgey trainer?
question: Hey professor, hope you've had a good day! Any tips for a beginner pidgey trainer?
answer:
• Pidgey are omnivores with a preference towards insects.
  • Make sure to have sticks and other nesting materials for Pidgey to build their nest with.
  • Pidgey will sometimes take dust baths, but you should still give your Pidgey a proper bath at least once a week.
  • They get along well with most Pokemon, but are wary around Electric-types and Ekans.
  • Pidgey are often considered one of the easiest Pokémon to care for due to their docile nature and small size.

- Professor Sakura

summary: Hello, do you have any advice on caring for a Marowak?
question: Hello, do you have any advice on caring for a Marowak?
answer:
• Marowak are omnivores.
  • Due to them being native to dry climates (or being part Fire-type in the Alolan variation’s case), Marowak don’t do well in the rain. I’d suggest keeping them inside.
  • They don’t get along with the Vullaby line due to…obvious reasons.
  • You should have a rock or log for them to practice their swings with.
  • If you have a Pokémon that tends to hoard things, such as Delibird, make sure to tell them not to take Marowak’s bone club. They’ll get really mad.
  • If a Marowak’s bone club breaks, you should help them find a replacement. Another bone or even a strong stick or a metal pipe will work.

body:
U.S: Here’s The NPD Sales Results For April 2019

The latest NPD data has been released. These sales results are for the month of April 2019. In terms of software, it was an interesting month for Nintendo. Super Smash Bros. Ultimate is still doing very well. Yoshi’s Crafted World has charted at #10. However, the big game of the month is Mortal Kombat 11. It has already charted very high in multiple categories, including the #2 slot for the…

summary: JAPANESE TV SHOW FOLLOWS FRENCH WOMAN ON HER JOURNEY TO PURCHASE AN AUTHENTIC COPY OF POKEMON GREEN
title: JAPANESE TV SHOW FOLLOWS FRENCH WOMAN ON HER JOURNEY TO PURCHASE AN AUTHENTIC COPY OF POKEMON GREEN
body:
Did you know that there’s a TV show in Japan called “Why Did You Come To Japan?” I had no idea until a few minutes ago! The show stops foreigners on the street to see what has brought them to Japan, and in the case of the woman above, she was out to add something to her Pokemon collection.

The woman wanted to track down an original copy of Pokemon Green, as she’s a Pokemon game collector and has hoping to get her hands on a copy for quite some time. As you might be able to guess, the woman did indeed find the game she was looking for, and was pretty ecstatic to add it to her collection.
